definition: to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: If there is not add regard for the five ray backlash destroy.
sentences.chinese: 如有不加顾念者五雷诛灭。

sentences.english: Then God remembered Rachel; he listened to her and opened her womb.
sentences.chinese: 神顾念拉结，应允了她，使她能生育。

sentences.english: As for Lester, he was affectionate and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 雷斯脱呢，对他也是多情的，顾念的。

sentences.english: but that your earnest care for us might be revealed in you in the sightof God.
sentences.chinese: 乃要在神面前把你们顾念我们的热心表明出来。

sentences.english: Remember that this is a promise to the man who considers the poor.
sentences.chinese: 上帝把这节经文的应许，赐给那些顾念穷人的义人。

sentences.english: For he has looked with favor on the lowliness of his servant.
sentences.chinese: 因为他顾念他使女的卑微。

definition: to take loving care of/to value
to stick up for a wrongdoer
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
father and elder brother(s)/head of the family/patriarch
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
